abstract: A Los Angeles judge ruled that companies controlled by Bob Yari, a financier of the movie, owed its director, co-writer and one of its stars $12 million for failing to pay profits to them.
snippet: A Los Angeles judge ruled that companies controlled by Bob Yari, a financier of the movie, owed its director, co-writer and one of its stars $12 million for failing to pay profits to them.
lead_paragraph: 6:05 p.m. | Updated LOS ANGELES — A judge here came down with a “boom!” last week on the financier behind “Crash,” which won the best picture Oscar in 2006.

headline.main: Judge Rules Against Backer of ‘Crash’ in Suit Over Payments
